newsitem.title: SWEDEN: TV4 says Marieberg bought stake in TV4.
newsitem.headline: TV4 says Marieberg bought stake in TV4.

text.p: Swedish television station TV4 said on Tuesday that Swedish media group Marieberg AB bought Swedish insurer SPP's stake in TV4.
"What I know is that SPP sold its stake to Marieberg," Erik Belfrage, chairman of TV4, told Reuters.

SPP had, according to newspaper Dagens Nyheter's ownership service, 193,000 series A shares and 2.75 million series B shares in TV4, corresponding to 14.7 percent of equity and 2.7 percent of votes in the television station.
"I assume that they are serious and seen from TV4's point of view it's always good to have knowledgable and long-term owners," he said.

Belfrage said he did not see a risk for disagreement between Marieberg and the current TV4 owners Investor AB, the key holding company in the Wallenberg family's financial empire, and investment company Kinnevik, which focuses on media.
"It should work so that outside the company you can pull in different directions, but within the company you work for the company's best," Belfrage said.
Belfrage did not know the reason for Marieberg's move or whether it had bought more TV4 shares in addition to the SPP holding. Belfrage is also a member of Investor's board.
Trading in Marieberg and TV4 shares was suspended on the Stockholm Stock Exchange on Tuesday.
